column1: # Data on the influence of the displacement energy threshold (E_th) on the final damage calculation.
# An estimation of the displacement energy is made with the formula cited in the work Passive Low-Energy Nuclear-Recoil Detection with Color Centers
# The displacement energy E_th is a function of the melting temperature T_m. The units for E_th and T_m are eV and K
# The melting point of quartz is T_m = (1650 ± 75)°C acording to https://www.cs.mcgill.ca/~rwest/wikispeedia/wpcd/wp/q/Quartz.htm.
# This results in a displacement energy of  E_th = (41.8 ± 1.3)eV => 40.5 eV < E_th < 43.1 eV with 68% of probability in this model.
